comment: I took Dr. Hill a few times, pre calc, I, and II. She was very helpful I still think of her to this day, 2 years later.

Take Ryan Wilson or Jon Noring instead. 
This a good prof if you want an easy A. However, if you're in a major where an in-depth understanding is crucial, you should look elsewhere.

Dr. Hill is an amazing professor, she lectures calculus extremely well and holds office hours to help struggling students. She drops so many grades in the class so it's extremely easy to pass with an A or B if you stay on top of homework and in-class assignments. She's also flexible when you need to makeup assessments. Loved her!
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Absolutely hands down one of the smartest and effective teachers at KSU. She has helped me in understanding and breaking down problems and never hesitates to answer your questions no matter how confusing they may sound. I was terrified of Calc II tbh, but she made it easy, just actually do the homework and practice exams and you'll be okay.
Best teacher ever
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: The worst thing about taking Calc 1 from her was the fact I had taken it Calc before and was bored out of my mind, this is because Dr Hill takes her time to help you and make sure you understand the content. If I knew someone who hadn't taken calculus before this is who I would recommend they take it from!
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Gives good feedback--Lots of homework

comment: really great at giving feedback. she was super encouraging all semester long!

I was a decent math student going into this class but I was quickly humbled, she really does care about her students but the number one reason why I did not get a higher score is because I didnt care about doing the homework, PLEASE DO THE HOMEWORK TAKE UR TIME AND UNDERSTAND IF U CAN DO THE HOMEWORK U CAN DO THE TESTS WITH EASE

Surprised to see her with a lower rating, she was one of the most available, and helpful professors I've had at KSU. She gives lots of opportunities for partial credit, and is readily available through email/office hours. This is a tough class, but she cares about you learning and will do all she can to get you through. Highly recommend.

I just finished taking Dr. Hill's Calculus class this semester, and she was wonderful. She always took the time to answer any questions that students were confused about and made difficult concepts easy to understand. I highly recommend taking her for Calculus, and I would definitely take her for Calculus 2 if there weren't time conflicts.

awsome. take her if you can. gives 10 extra credits on the final and it replaces your lowest test grade. In summer we had either a quiz or a test every Thursday which means every 4 sessions but you have plenty of practice to use. make sure to do the practice tests because even the quizzes sometimes come straight from them. drops a lot of homeworks

I have never been someone who is good at math so walking into this course I was worried for the outcome. But Dr. Hill really is such an amazing professor that someone who almost failed precalc got an A in calculus and an A on the final exam. She is a very lenient grader and give lots of partial credit which is so important in a math course.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Took Dr. Hill for the Spring semester and found Dr. Hill to be one of the best teachers at KSU. She responds to emails very quickly and has plenty of office hours to help with any questions you might have. There are also plenty of opportunities for extra credit. If you are trying to decide on which Calc 2 professor to take you should take Dr. Hill

Professor Hill was an amazing calculus professor. Calculus I can be hard but I feel like she broke down the topics pretty easily. Her weekly homework was helpful for the tests and quizzes. As long as you practice and put in the work, you'll be fine in the class.

Dr. Hill is literally one of the sweetest teachers I've had so far. If you need help she'll bend over backwards to help you. She genuinely cares about not just you learning the material but mastering it. I'll honestly miss her because if she wasn't my professor this class would have felt like another hard prerequisite.

She is great when it comes to teaching because she oversimplifies information and even gives steps on how to do problems. Her lecture notes and feedback on quizzes is very helpful. She is very kind-hearted and genuine and if you struggle she gives lots of extra credit so that even if you struggle you can improve your grade. The homework is difficul

I honestly struggled in calculus 1 and thought I'd get like a C- in calculus 2 but because she explains not only how to problems but even the conceptual part of why we do this and how it is done makes a really hard class seem easy. I am glad I took her and she gives a lot of extra credit.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: If you don't do the work how she wants it and you still get the right answer then either you get 1 point for "attempting" or no credit on the question, even though you got it right. Also, if your work is not how she wants it but you still get the right answer, then you'll barely get any points. She's not a bad teacher, it's just her grading.

Attendance isn't required, but she regularly gives graded homework quizzes and in-class activities so it's in your best interest to attend as much as you can. There are many opportunities to get your grade up (dropped quiz/homework grades, test corrections, etc.). Also very available outside of class. She makes Calc 2 a lot more manageable.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Beware of pop quizzes--Accessible outside class

comment: Amazing teacher but a hard course for some
Good teacher hard course for some
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Beware of pop quizzes--Test heavy

comment: Dr Hill is an amazing Calculus 1 professor. Calc is harder than college algebra obviously you have to put in work! She also gave us makeup opportunities for tests. These people that left bad reviews were never in class. I sat behind a lot of them that complained about her work, and they would skip classes. If you can take her, do it!!!!

She's a kind professor who really wants you to do your best and she provides you with plenty of resources. Her test were about 7 questions and quizzes 1 or 2 so there wasn't much room for error. The test and quizzes were SO much harder than the practice and homework.

Most people that dislike Dr. Hill feel this way because they were unprepared for the subject's difficulty. Calculus is a hard class and that will be the case no matter who your professor is. She has well structured lectures and the homework does a good job at preparing you for the tests. The homework can be hard though. Same with quizzes and tests

dont take this class if u aren't prepared to put everything else aside, including other classes. Professor Hill would teach one thing in class but the test are nothing she discussed. she would attempt to provide "practice exams" but they were dumbed down and extremely easy compared to the exam. she doesn't explain. don't take this class with her

You going to quit your job or any fun stuff you do to PASS her class, not an A but a pass grade. She does not provide a good PRACTICE TEST but rather an old practice test that won't appear on the exams just to waste your time. It doesn't matter if you clock A's in math with her you can easily get an F. Don't take her if you are a busy person.

She is one of the most helpful professors ever, and a very caring person. She explains content thoroughly and gives many examples. She also creates a welcoming environment for questions so that everyone understands what is going on. There is a bit of homework but it's very manageable, and the tests are not hard if you pay attention in class.

This professor is awful!! She doesn't know how to teach and she doesn't care about her students at all!! She does what she wants and when asked if she can give out a curve, she gets offended and then gets mad!! She is mean and doesn't care about her students' grades at all!! Save yourself and your grades and don't take her!!

Dr. Hill was the best math professor I ever had. She explained all of the topics very well, was nice to you if you had a question, and was quick to help you out. Though Calculus is a hard subject, Dr. Hill made it as easy as it can be 5/5. Then if you were struggling in the class she gave out test corrections to boost your grade.

Dr. Hill is an outstanding teacher who goes out of her way to help you understand things in a way that makes sense to your mind. Her tests are tough and the questions are usually extreme but they could be worse. She gave many second chances/extra credit. This class was very challenging and has given me a good grasp on the fundamentals of calc one.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Be aware of people who are telling you not to listen to the bad experience many have had. These were most likely people with little college experience or they want to be a teachers pet. The professor is good at lecture but her exams are difficult usually consisting of problems that have hidden or nuanced rules you probably won't remember/know

She is a super strict grader, does not like to give room to bring up your grade, her tests are always harder than her practice problems. She makes you make your own study guides. She does not like to work out problems to show you how to do them, she wants to give you the thereom and expects you to be able to apply it.

She assigns a LOT of Homework and there are weekly quizzes. Personally I think that her exams are extremely difficult for no reason. The Class average for 3/4 was in the 50s%. She does not curve, nor does she provide extra credit. She also grades incredibly harsh. Seems like no matter how much you study, you probably wont receive any more than a 65

Please don't take her unless you want to guarantee yourself a fail!! She doesn't care about her students and ensures their time in calculus is hell!! She doesn't know how to teach at all and gets offended when someone asks to improve their grade!! Calculus is already a hard subject and she doesn't do anything to help you out!! Don't take her!!!!!!!

DR HILL IS AWFUL!!! Don't take unless you want to fail!!! She doesn't curve any tests and when my class asked for extra credit, she got offended and got mad at us for asking that. My class's average on 3/4 test was in the 50's and she is doing nothing about that!! Trust me save yourself from her!!

DON'T TAKE UNLESS YOU WANT TO FAIL. calc is already a hard class but she does not make it any easier. I studied so hard for every single unit and couldn't get anything higher than a 65. she would take several points off exams for the smallest reasons and gets mad if you asked for extra credit. this class had me rethinking my major.

DON'T TAKE DR HILL. This class consists of 9 quizzes, 4 tests+1 final, and Achieve homework. The quizzes are 2 questions each so you have to know your information. She is always behind in grading. I have never got less than an A in math and now I will be lucky to pass with a C. So please if you can, don't take her if you want to pass!!!

Ignore all low graded reviews, Calculus 1 is a difficult subject especially if you are in your early years of college. Dr. Hill makes it incredibly digestible and easy. If you want to truly learn Calculus, take this professor.

Although Calculus is hard no matter what professor you have, however, she is not making things any easier. She makes you create your own study guide for the test and predict what will be on it (apparently this is the 1st year she's decided to try it out), she goes over easy problems then feeds you to the wolves with homework, quizzes and exams.
Literally the greatest math teacher/professor I've ever had, made calc 2 so much easier and if you have the opportunity to take her, do it.
She is super amazing and will always be available to help especially during office hours and will help you improve.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: I enjoyed having Dr. Hill for Calc 2. Its a hard subject to teach and she did everything in her power to make sure we understood the content. She uploads her notes after the lecture and is always willing to help outside of class. She offered multiple opportunities to make up points missed such as redemption assignments and alternate hw assignments.

I had her for Math1109 as well and let's just say there is a drastic change. I understand Calc 2 is supposed to be harder than calc 1, but her tests were insane. She gave the hardest type of each question without any practice of similar questions to tests. She is oblivious to how badly the class is doing. 3/4 of class dropped and test avg was 48%.

She is very kind and willing to work with you (I got a concussion right before a test and was given the option to replace my grade on the final). There is extra credit on most exams, only 80% completion on the homework was required for full credit. Sometimes holds exam review sessions during office hours before exams.

I TOOK FOR CALC 2. She is a really good professor and really wants you to succeed. You need to practice. If you are willing to work you will easily do well in the class, if not you aren't going to do well. The study guides are very similar to the tests.

Dr.Hill was one of the best math professors I've had. She's very knowledgeable and explains concepts very well in her lectures. Her exams are hard but fair and she does what she can to give you partial credit. No matter the professor, calculus is difficult and requires a lot of practice. She's a great professor if you really want to understand calc

Dr.Hill is a great professor for Calculus 1. Although Calculus is challenging, she does an excellent job of teaching it without adding additional stress. Throughout the course, she often will give extra credit and very strong curves with lenient grading. If you are taking Calculus with Dr.Hill I highly recommend attending her office hours.

She helped me understand some concepts, but sometimes she just confused me. She's as good as a calculus teacher can get in my opinion. Pros: She is relatable and understanding. Cons: Her exams are unnecessarily hard. While hearing about my friend's calc professor, I probably would have done much better in their classes compared to mine.

I liked Dr. Hill as a person and she seemed to be a good math teacher, but a big problem was the fact that the tests were EXTREMELY difficult. The tests seem to be the most extreme and difficult version of the examples you learn in class. Calculus is a difficult subject no doubt, but I know very few people made As or Bs on the tests.
Words cannot describe how much I cant stand this woman. Do not take.

Dr.Hill is excellent, she really wants the students to understand it, and she always tries to give credit where she can, she has office hours that are really helpful to review the material went over in class and she has almost weekly quizzes but they are usually just the easier version of problems, and it helps you remember them
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Lecture heavy

comment: Miss hill was an incredibly nice person and i could tell she really wanted us to succeed in the class however I have gone to tutoring every day and spent outside class time on this person and still struggling. You have a quiz every week over the hardest version of a problem. She also expects you to remember pre calc 100% through and recite things.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Graded by few things

comment: 9/10 would math again
Best math professor

Although she is very knowledgeable about calculus, she is rather incompetent when it comes to effectively teaching students. Do not do it, save yourself the pain and stress, there are better options. Calculus is not easy, you will need a professor who is capable. She is very smart, but horrible professor overall.
hard class, younger and cool professor but not very good at teaching. avoid if you can, only passed because of my tutor.

Halfway through the class, less than 10 people left and I KNOW of those 10 at least 4 failed. You must attend class as she likes to count participation points randomly. She loves the pop quizzes/assignments. Don't be late to class because she does the quiz at the beginning and if you are late you lose out on the 20 minutes you have to take the quiz
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Beware of pop quizzes--Test heavy

comment: Worst class ive ever taken. Shes a bad professor and taking it over the summer made it even worse. She teaches too fast and makes you do a classwork for a grade directly after teaching. Avoid taking her, she gets a kick out of how hard the math is for students. not understanding whatsoever.

Tests are the hardest version of each type of problem & graded heavy. quizzes everyday. she doesnt work out each type of problem. Is not helpful if you have an emergency. Nice person, terrible prof. You must be at every class or you will miss classwork and quiz that you cant make up no matter what. Does not encourage use of other study resources.

Dr. Hill is an amazing professor and an amazing person. She genuinely cares about her students and wants us to succeed. She is very quick to respond to emails and is always willing to meet outside of class if needed. My only issue was that if you missed class you cant make up any of the assignments or quizzes which can be a bit of a set back.

Ms. Hill was an excellent teacher overall. She was kind and helpful; she clearly enjoys her subject and wants you to succeed. I took the 4-hour (2 meetings per week) class, which was straining, but her lectures were helpful if not always interesting. If you care and put in some effort you'll succeed, but you really have to show up every day.

Dr. Hill is a fun lecturer and gives great feedback during class and office hours. Precalc is really hard and she wants you to pass. She gives example worksheets during lectures to help go over topics that work great as notes to use during the homework. She also gives partial credit on exam questions and some extra credit. Highly recommend.

I never actually realized what an amazing math professor Dr. Hill was until after I experienced a different math professor. Dr. Hill always went slow and helped us leave the "lectures" all of the knowledge we needed to complete Aleks and get a good grade on the test. And she has an AMAZING personality as well, which is rare for math teachers.

Honestly, she was super sweet i just don't think she is meant for teaching or specifically lecturing. she teaches incredibly fast, lots of homework, no calculator, and no formula sheets every other math professor lets you have one. She even at one point sent emails complaining from a survey she made us do because we complained she talked to fast.
She is sooo good!!

She provides notes that we do every class and uploads examples. HW is ALEKS, but she can't change that. I haven't done the best on her tests, but they are from her study guides and do not take away from how great a teacher she truly is. She adjusts her class based on how well students are learning, even asks for feedback, and wants you to pass.

This is a fast paced course but keep in mind there is so much to cover. Dr. Hill does a great job at explaining the heavy material & even provides office hours for additional help. Sometimes she stays back after class for questions. ALEKS is a huge part of the class and your grade so stay on top of HW. Calculators are almost NEVER used in exams.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: She went fast through the material but the content wasnt bad. She held virtual hours and did study guides. The only thing I did not like was her taking off points even if you got the problem right. I did not always show all of the work and she would take off a lot of points which hurt my grade, because of it I lost my gpa to that.

You can tell she cares about students and what she teaches. Content is hard but she does her best to help students who are struggling. She does go a little fast sometimes but if you ask her to go over certain things she will. The tests are pretty hard but she provides study guides and she sometimes uses questions from the study guide on the tests.

While she teaches extremely fast, she does her best to ensure every student gets the concept and will go out of her way to find something that will work for students struggling. She supported me when I started losing hope in the class, and her confidence kept me on the right path. (do all the homework for an overall good grade!)
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Participation matters

comment: I would recommend Dr. Hill. The homework is online on ALEKS and its pretty easy and we have a week to get it done. Before the test if you do the study guide you should do fine on the test. in class we learned really easy math so it was annoying to sit through what I already knew and then the homework was a bit more of teaching it to myself.

Very good professor. She was willing to help if you had any questions. Shes very through and explains all the steps for problems and even puts multiple study guides up for exams. The more you come to class the more you will understand the work and pass. Several extra credit points too.

She is a new, young professor, so she understands your struggles. She thoroughly answers questions and gives great lectures. Gives weekly hw on ALEKS, but it is extremely easy due to her excellent teacher. I couldn't have asked for a better math teacher my freshman year! Must take!

I would recommend if you remember algebra from highschool. Everything is on ALEKS so if you don't like this website DON'T take this class. I personally liked it. She provides study guides and as long as you show up and apply yourself the tests shouldn't be hard.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.
